headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Revisits Issue of Harsh Sentences for Juveniles
headline.seo: Supreme Court Revisits Issue of Sentences for Juveniles
headline.main: Supreme Court Revisits Issue of Harsh Sentences for Juveniles

docs.snippet: In arguments on Tuesday, a majority of justices appeared ready to take an additional step in limiting such punishments, but it was not clear whether it would be modest or large....
docs.abstract: Majority of Supreme Court justices, in arguments over what the Constitution has to say about harsh sentences imposed on juvenile offenders, appear ready to take an additional step in limiting such punishments, but it is not clear whether it would be modest or large; cases concern defendants who were 14 when they were involved in killings.
docs.lead_paragraph: In arguments on Tuesday, a majority of justices appeared ready to take an additional step in limiting such punishments, but it was not clear whether it would be modest or large.

headline.print_headline: Killings Could Stall Election’s Nationalist Turn
headline.seo: Killings Could Taint French Presidential Campaign
headline.main: Killings Could Stall Election’s Nationalist Turn

docs.snippet: In the middle of a heated presidential race, shootings at a Jewish school have raised new questions about the tone of a debate about what it is to be French....
docs.abstract: Memo from France; shootings at a Jewish school, coming in the middle of a heated presidential race, have inspired soul-searching among mourners about the tone of anti-immigration political talk and notions of French identity that have become central to public discourse; centrist presidential candidate Francois Bayrou suggests that racially-tinged crimes are a natural outgrowth of rising intolerance, and accuseds Pres Nicholas Sarkozy of pandering to the right in order to retain his office.

byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Toulouse, France, and Maïa de la Baume from Paris.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the middle of a heated presidential race, shootings at a Jewish school have raised new questions about the tone of a debate about what it is to be French.

headline.main: Want Loyal Customers? Giving Them Hope Helps

docs.snippet: If we in New York know one thing about professional sports ownership it is that being a rascal or a rogue is not necessarily relevant to the question of consumer loyalty....
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column asserts that New York Mets fans will remain loyal to owner Fred Wilpon only if he produces a winning team.
docs.lead_paragraph: If we in New York know one thing about professional sports ownership it is that being a rascal or a rogue is not necessarily relevant to the question of consumer loyalty.

docs.abstract: Editorial calls on the Cuban government to release Alan Gross, an American who was sentenced to 15 years in prison for allegedly subversive activities.
docs.lead_paragraph: As an act of mercy, the Cuban government should release Mr. Gross. A 15-year sentence for his visa and permit violations is absurd and inhumane.
